headline: These Are the 5 Worst-Performing Stocks in the Nasdaq-100 With 2024 Almost Over
summary: The Nasdaq-100 index tracks the largest 100 non-financial companies on the Nasdaq stock exchange.  Although it's not a part of the U.S. stock market's big three indexes (S&P 500, Nasdaq Composite, and Dow Jones), the Nasdaq-100 has grown in popularity over the years because of its concentration of tech stocks (almost 60%), many of which have seen their valuations skyrocket in recent years.  Through Nov. 22, the Nasdaq-100 is up over 23%, which is impressive for a broad index.
